entries.meaning: Alternative spelling of Saluki (“a breed of hound originating in the Middle East”)

description: Unknown. Attested in print from the 1950s; likely used earlier.

entries.meaning: (informal, US, New York) A keep-away game in which children throw around an object with the aim of keeping it away from a particular child (often the owner of the object) or from another group of children; keepings off.
examples: Synonyms: keep-away, monkey in the middle, piggy in the middle
